results.title: Four views on landscape
results.brief_description: This film prvides an animated reconstruction of some of the major works of Constable, Turner, Van Gogh and Monet. The simple level of the animation and screen text make it suitable for use at primary level.

results.title: Four more days
results.creator_credit: George Pashuk and University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre
results.brief_description: Experimental study of three different prison environments. The central question raised is: ”What sorts of changes are required in prisons in order to produce a system of human relationships consistent with a correctional rather than a custodial orientation?”
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Pashuk and University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre

results.title: Four men of India
results.brief_description: Life in widely different regions of India is illustrated by the backgrounds of four typical Hindustan Lever employees, in Calcutta, Kerala, the Kulu Valley and Rajasthan.

results.title: Four figure flight
results.brief_description: The British Test Pilot, Peter Twiss, tells the story of his successful attempt on the world air-speed record. Shows ground preparations at the Royal Aircraft Establishment at Boscombe Down, the radar control room which helped to keep the aircraft on course, the camera posts with their electronic timing equipment, and the Fairey Delat II on its record-breaking run of over 1100 miles per hour.

results.title: Foundations of mathematics
results.creator_credit: Steve Campus and Steve Campus Productions
results.brief_description: Designed to show teachers working in the area of infant mathematics possible ways of using concrete equipment with an emphasis on formal pre-number work. Covers classifying and grouping; pattern; counting; equivalence; estimation; measurement; and shape. Suitable for lower primary and tertiary/teacher levels.

results.title: Foster's release
results.creator_credit: Terence Winkless, Milton C. Hubatka and Verexal Productions
results.brief_description: A suspenseful drama about a girl who, while babysitting, is the victim of anonymous telephone calls. She tries to have the calls traced. In the taut climax the telephone company and the police work feverishly to reach the girl in time to avert a tragedy. Combines atmospheric music and good use of camera shots including long shots, overhead and close-ups.

results.title: [Return to Michigan]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Week”.
In 1976, tragedy struck the farmers at Michigan. A poisonous chemical, PBB, had been mixed into stock food, and all livestock had to be killed and the contamination was passed on through foods for human consumption causing much illness.

results.title: Material unaccounted for
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Week”.
Investigates the security of the nuclear plant at which Karen Silkwood worked before her mysterious death. Radioactive material had been placed in Ms. Silkwood’s home during the period in which she was campaigning against the working conditions and safety measures at the U.S. American plant.
